abstract.text: Send data between players in a real-time multiplayer game.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Exchanging data between players in real-time games

inlineContent.text: In a multiplayer game, you can exchange game data between players to synchronize the state of the game or to facilitate communication between players. You can begin exchanging data when two or more players join or after all the player slots fill when you start the game. For example, if your game provides text messaging, players can send messages to each other while they wait for other players to join the game. GameKit handles the low-level communication of generic data; you design the structure of your game data, and implement the interface for presenting or entering that data.
When enough players join a multiplayer game, you can begin exchanging data. For example, present an interface for players to send text messages.
If you use the
class to find players, you can start the game and begin exchanging data when GameKit calls the
delegate method.
To begin exchanging data before the game starts, implement the

property in the method to determine when you can begin exchanging data. If two or more players join the game, you can begin exchanging data, or if the expected player count is

inlineContent.text: To reinvite players whose match state becomes disconnected in a two-player match, implement the
delegate method to return
GameKit exchanges generic data between players to give you flexibility in designing your game data. You just need to convert your model objects to a

object before you send it. Then, you choose the type of transmission and size of the data depending on the characteristics of your game. You can send data to a subset of players or all players in the game.
Use the
or
method to send data to one or more players. To guarantee that players receive the data in the order you send it, pass
as the data mode. If the data is small and a delay in transmission invalidates its contents (such as position and velocity in a real-time game), pass
as the data mode.
The following example shows how to convert a string to a
object and send it as a message from one player to another player.

inlineContent.text: For large data or many players, you can layer a network topology that performs better over the peer-to-peer topology that GameKit provides. For example, reduce the network traffic by implementing a client-server or ring topology. If you send data only to and from one player, you can reduce the network connections by half.
If you choose a client-server topology, use the
delegate method to find the player with the best network connection to act as the server. Invoke this method simultaneously in each game instance running on each playerâ€™s device.
Finally, you process the data that players receive from other players. For the recipients of the data, implement the
delegate method to unpack the data sent by other players. For example, if the data contains a text message from another player, convert the
object to a string. To display which player sent the data, use the player parameter.

code: // Receive a message sent from one player to another.
func match(_ match: GKMatch, didReceive data: Data, fromRemotePlayer player: GKPlayer){

Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
An invitation to join a match sent to the local player from another player.
A protocol that handles invite events from Game Center.
A peer-to-peer network between a group of players that sign into Game Center.
Sends data continuously until the recipients successfully receive it or the connection times out.
Sends data once even if an error occurs.
Determines the best player in the game to act as the server for a client-server topology.
The remaining number of players invited but not yet connected to the match.
Transmits data to one or more players connected to the match.
Transmits data to all players connected to the match.
Processes the data sent from another player to the local player.
Handles when players connect or disconnect from a match.
Determines whether the local player should reinvite another player who disconnected from a two-player match.
An object that encapsulates the parameters to create a real-time or turn-based match.
An object that creates matches with other players without presenting an interface to the players.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a real-time game and automatch to fill any empty slots.
Handles when the view controller finds players for a peer-to-peer match.
Enable players to voice chat with all, or groups of, players in a multiplayer game.

abstract.text: Game Center applies different type of rules you create in a particular order to find the best matches.
